stadium.name: The South Pole Palisade
stadium.description: A crude, fortified playing field built from rough-hewn logs. It's less a stadium and more a stockade against the wilderness. The 'grass' is mostly frozen mud and straw.

stats.pregame_ritual: Smelling their own game-worn socks from the previous match.
Braiding their hair into tight, battle-ready rows.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Polishing their boots with bacon grease.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.
Turning their helmet around three times before putting it on.
Licking a whetstone.

stadium.name: The Aegis Field
stadium.description: A pristine field within the main temple compound, used as the central training ground for the Shield. The pitch is bordered by the library and monastery, and is said to be protected by the twin lights, Dawn's Hope and Silver Twilight.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Re-taping their shield's handle with fresh leather.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Drinking a full waterskin of lukewarm water.
Drawing a detailed, anatomically incorrect diagram of a troll's head.
Passing a 'team luckstone' from player to player without speaking.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Challenging a spectator to a game of tic-tac-toe in the dirt.
Re-taping their shield's handle with fresh leather.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Passing a 'team luckstone' from player to player without speaking.

Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.

preGame: # üèüÔ∏è TUESDAY NIGHT TROLLBALL AT THE FRONTIER! Step right up, sports fans, and brace yourselves for a real bone-chilling spectacle! It‚Äôs Nok the Corrupter here, coming to you live from the South Pole Palisade, where the wind is howling and the mud is harder than a dwarf's skull! It‚Äôs the final week of the season, and the air is thick with the scent of pine and impending medical bills! We‚Äôve got a real clash of cultures tonight, folks! On one side, those goody-two-shoes from the Temple of Light, The Haven Lights, are looking far too clean for my tastes! I spotted Zwart Bunns whispering a secret fear to the trollball earlier‚Äîprobably telling it how much he hates the cold! And Shiroma Salim is over there obsessively re-taping his shield handle. Do they think a little leather will save them from a Yeti's mallet? I doubt it! On the other side of the frozen pitch, we have our hosts, the South Pole Yetis! Now these are my kind of people! Udela Dorkus was seen licking a whetstone in the dugout‚Äîthat‚Äôs the spirit of Trollball right there! And keep an eye on Selima Si, who‚Äôs wearing her lucky garish undergarments today! I hope they‚Äôre wool, because this Freezing Rain is no joke! This crude log stockade they call a stadium is currently under the Wolf Pack Howling modifier, and let me tell you, those wolves sound hungry for more than just victory! I hope Imra the Master of Elixirs has her bar tab ready, because after this match, the players are going to need more than just a healing spell to forget the frostbite! Let‚Äôs see if those Haven 'heroes' like Sir Tanos' friends can handle a real frontier fight! It‚Äôs time to play some Trollball! üèîÔ∏èü•Öüèà
postGame: ## üèîÔ∏è CRUNCH TIME AT THE PALISADE: HAVEN HITS HARD! What a display of absolute carnage we just witnessed, folks! My ears are still ringing with the sound of snapping timber and even louder snapping collarbones! The Haven Lights might have walked away with a 4 to 2 victory, but the South Pole Yetis turned that frozen field into a crimson slushie! It‚Äôs a real shame those Temple-dwelling light-lovers won, but you can‚Äôt argue with the brutality they displayed! ü©∏ The action started with a bang when Ajit Serge absolutely leveled Tybi Reo, sending her straight to the healer before the first whistle had even cooled! But the Lights didn't blink; Berkin Waters launched a surgical shot from Center Field, putting those shiny boys on the board early with two points! The Yetis weren't taking it lying down, though! Coussoule Bidle decided Marlane Lounge needed a nap and delivered a tackle that would have made Lord Orzalon proud! üî® Then came the speed! Sayers Erdda charged through the Icy Field like a runaway wagon, dunking the ball into the goal and making the log palisade shake! The crowd‚Äîwhat few were brave enough to face the Freezing Rain‚Äîwent absolutely wild! But the Lights' Coward Tarton showed some real defensive greed, snagging a wild pass out of the air like a common street thief! üß• After the halftime reset, where the healers worked overtime to stitch the Yetis back together, the blood really started to flow! Dickenson Beker decided revenge was best served cold, crunching Hilaire Guevara into the mud! Shiroma Salim then showed us why he's a name to fear, scoring another two-point shot and then immediately sending Jessy Debbie to the dirt! ü©π It was a revolving door for the healers! Riffle Heyde, who drinks lukewarm water like a weirdo, proved they have a mean streak by knocking Sale Tocci right out of the match! Despite the Yetis finding one last burst of energy for a Duky Orelee dunk, the Lights were just too clinical in their violence! üíÄ Wieren Ivar put the final nail in the coffin, delivering a bone-shattering tackle to Isborne Krause that had the wolves howling in approval! Even that little guy Cinnemon would have been shaking in his tiny boots seeing the hits these Yetis took! üç∑ It‚Äôs a bitter pill to swallow seeing the Haven Lights clinch this one, but credit where credit is due‚Äîthey left a lot of Yeti teeth on the ice! The popularity of these teams might be low, but the level of physical trauma was top-shelf! If Elspeth Ortell has that ritual sangria ready, I suggest the Yetis drink the whole bowl! Final score: Haven Lights 4, South Pole Yetis 2! We‚Äôre heading into the playoffs, savages, so sharpen your axes and stay corrupted! üèÜüòàüî•
